rename.from: Databricks: Cannot register sklearn model because of Metadata issue when workspace experiment
rename.to: Databricks: Cannot register sklearn model because of Metadata issue when using workspace experiment

body:
I have the similar issue. 
I log and store the artifacts (conda.yml, MLModel, mode file) in the ml flow tracking server in Azure Databricks. But afterward, I download these file and upload them to Azure DataLake storage. Then I tried to read from the DataLake storage with "load_model" and I can see the model is loaded successfully and the metadata of model is also available.

However, after I registered the model, although the operation seemed to succeed, in the "Model" UI in Databricks, it said the same error "Failed registration. The given source path does not exist.". Therefore, I can't serve the model as a web service.

My goal is able to somehow make the ML models available in another Azure Databricks instance.

Probably because your new imported registered model is still pointing to the run URI on the old tracking server. You would need to import the run too. Migrating experiments/runs/models isn't well articulated in MLflow.
This may help: https://github.com/amesar/mlflow-tools/tree/master/mlflow_tools/export_import

> Probably because your new imported registered model is still pointing to the run URI on the old tracking server. You would need to import the run too. Migrating experiments/runs/models isn't well articulated in MLflow.
> This may help: https://github.com/amesar/mlflow-tools/tree/master/mlflow_tools/export_import

Thanks Andre for the guidance. Will definitely try it out.

@Mika24 Let us know if this works, so we can close this issue.
cheers!

@dmatrix My original issue is a bit different from @Mika24 issue.

I am working within Databricks. When I have a workspace experiement which is logging and saving aritifcats to my Azure Datalake, I expect to register a model from that workspace experiment given that artifact location. However, Mlflow is not logging the metadata correctly. When I go to register the model from the UI, it says that "Failed registration. The given source path does not exist" despite Mlflow having saved the artificats to my datalake itself. The metadata tracking doesnt appear to log that the models are located on my datalake and not within the Databricks mlflow filestore

@claywey 
Can you try something simple on your Azure Databricks?

```
[def print_experiment_info(experiment):
  print("Name: {}".format(experiment.name))
  print("Experiment ID: {}".format(experiment.experiment_id))
  print("Artifact Location: {}".format(experiment.artifact_location))
  print("Lifecycle_stage: {}".format(experiment.lifecycle_stage))
  
def print_run_info(run):
  print("run_id: {}".format(run.info.run_id))
  print("experiment_id: {}".format(run.info.experiment_id))
  print("params: {}".format(run.data.params))
  print("artifact_uri: {}".format(run.info.artifact_uri))
  print("status: {}".format(run.info.status))

import mlflow
import mlflow.sklearn
import numpy as np

from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

print(mlflow.__version__)

mlflow.sklearn.autolog()
# train a model
model = LinearRegression()

# Create four runs
for i in range(4):
  with mlflow.start_run() as run:
    X = np.array([[1, 1*i], [1, 2*i], [2, 2*i], [2, 3*i]])
    y = np.dot(X, np.array([1, 2])) + i
    model.fit(X, y)
    print("run_id: {}".format(run.info.run_id))

from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
experiment = MlflowClient().get_experiment(<expriment_id>)
run = MlflowClient().get_run(<run_id>)

# Show experiment and run info
print_experiment_info(experiment)
print_run_info(run)](url)

print("registry_uri: {}".format(mlflow.get_registry_uri()))
print("tracking_uri: {}".format(mlflow.get_tracking_uri()))
```


Are the artifact URI from the experiment and run have the same prefix? For Azure will be blob URI
(I've installed mlflow version 1.11.0)

@claywey if you set an experiment then make sure that when you start that run, that run is logged under that experiment if that's where you want your runs to log under.

For example,

```
from mlflow.tracking import MlflowClient
experiment_id = MlflowClient().create_experiment("/Users/jules@databricks.com/issue_3490")

 with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment_id):
     .....
     ...

```

@dmatrix 

The runs are being logged and I can see them clearly. Passing in the experiment_id when calling start_run() is not the issue. The set_experiment() method works. I have also tried passing the experiment_id as you just mentioned and have gotten the same effect. 

In the attached photo, everything circled in red is as I expect. This run logged my run, created and stored my artifacts to my datalake. But if you look at the area circled in blue, that is where I am getting the "Failed registration. The given source path does not exist." error. I am not able to add the model to the model registry. This is one of the runs I created via the code you provided earlier. (Note: "iris" is just the test model name I have been using)


![Mlflow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57914269/95639490-96ed2d00-0a66-11eb-9a1c-c5bb611db255.PNG)

@claywey Hmm, this is a bit weird. I would start anew. 

1. Delete the runs
2. Delete the experiment


Now try without creating or setting an experiment. Just the Default experiment.

Is `Lucina` your login id?  When you create or set an experiment, what paths if any are you setting in the dialog?

![Screen Shot 2020-10-14 at 11 53 39 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1117597/96032759-002cc180-0e14-11eb-9803-25fc0a76b6e0.png)


Are you setting any artifact location? 

What is the /mnt/lake? Assume your dbfs mount point
